domains.description: This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles) have an associated `id` used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has a specific `id` structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds. CSS objects can be loaded using the `get*ForNode()` calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client can also keep track of stylesheets via the `styleSheetAdded`/`styleSheetRemoved` events and subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the `getStyleSheet[Text]()` methods.

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an `id`. This `id` can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that `iframe` owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

types.description: Unique DOM node identifier used to reference a node that may not have been pushed to the front-end.
Backend node with a friendly name.
DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes. DOMNode is a base node mirror type.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the `nodeId`. Backend will only push node with given `id` once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

domains.description: This domain facilitates obtaining document snapshots with DOM, layout, and style information.

types.description: A Node in the DOM tree.

properties.name: textValue
properties.description: Only set for textarea elements, contains the text value.

properties.name: inputValue
properties.description: Only set for input elements, contains the input's associated text value.

properties.name: inputChecked
properties.description: Only set for radio and checkbox input elements, indicates if the element has been checked

properties.name: optionSelected
properties.description: Only set for option elements, indicates if the element has been selected

properties.name: childNodeIndexes
properties.description: The indexes of the node's child nodes in the `domNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`, if any.

properties.name: pseudoElementIndexes
properties.description: Indexes of pseudo elements associated with this node in the `domNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`, if any.

properties.name: layoutNodeIndex
properties.description: The index of the node's related layout tree node in the `layoutTreeNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`, if any.

properties.name: documentURL
properties.description: Document URL that `Document` or `FrameOwner` node points to.

properties.name: baseURL
properties.description: Base URL that `Document` or `FrameOwner` node uses for URL completion.

properties.name: contentLanguage
properties.description: Only set for documents, contains the document's content language.

properties.name: documentEncoding
properties.description: Only set for documents, contains the document's character set encoding.

properties.name: frameId
properties.description: Frame ID for frame owner elements and also for the document node.

properties.name: contentDocumentIndex
properties.description: The index of a frame owner element's content document in the `domNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`, if any.

properties.name: importedDocumentIndex
properties.description: Index of the imported document's node of a link element in the `domNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`, if any.

properties.name: templateContentIndex
properties.description: Index of the content node of a template element in the `domNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`.

properties.name: pseudoType
properties.description: Type of a pseudo element node.

properties.name: isClickable
properties.description: Whether this DOM node responds to mouse clicks. This includes nodes that have had click event listeners attached via JavaScript as well as anchor tags that naturally navigate when clicked.

properties.name: eventListeners
properties.description: Details of the node's event listeners, if any.

properties.name: currentSourceURL
properties.description: The selected url for nodes with a srcset attribute.

properties.name: originURL
properties.description: The url of the script (if any) that generates this node.

types.description: Details of post layout rendered text positions. The exact layout should not be regarded as stable and may change between versions.

properties.name: startCharacterIndex
properties.description: The starting index in characters, for this post layout textbox substring. Characters that would be represented as a surrogate pair in UTF-16 have length 2.

properties.name: numCharacters
properties.description: The number of characters in this post layout textbox substring. Characters that would be represented as a surrogate pair in UTF-16 have length 2.

types.description: Details of an element in the DOM tree with a LayoutObject.

properties.name: domNodeIndex
properties.description: The index of the related DOM node in the `domNodes` array returned by `getSnapshot`.

properties.name: layoutText
properties.description: Contents of the LayoutText, if any.

properties.name: inlineTextNodes
properties.description: The post-layout inline text nodes, if any.

properties.name: styleIndex
properties.description: Index into the `computedStyles` array returned by `getSnapshot`.

properties.name: paintOrder
properties.description: Global paint order index, which is determined by the stacking order of the nodes. Nodes that are painted together will have the same index. Only provided if includePaintOrder in getSnapshot was true.

types.description: A subset of the full ComputedStyle as defined by the request whitelist.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Name/value pairs of computed style properties.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables DOM snapshot agent for the given page.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables DOM snapshot agent for the given page.

commands.name: getSnapshot
commands.description: Returns a document snapshot, including the full DOM tree of the root node (including iframes, template contents, and imported documents) in a flattened array, as well as layout and white-listed computed style information for the nodes. Shadow DOM in the returned DOM tree is flattened.

parameters.name: computedStyleWhitelist
parameters.description: Whitelist of computed styles to return.

parameters.name: includeEventListeners
parameters.description: Whether or not to retrieve details of DOM listeners (default false).

parameters.name: includePaintOrder
parameters.description: Whether to determine and include the paint order index of LayoutTreeNodes (default false).

parameters.name: includeUserAgentShadowTree
parameters.description: Whether to include UA shadow tree in the snapshot (default false).

returns.name: domNodes
returns.description: The nodes in the DOM tree. The DOMNode at index 0 corresponds to the root document.

returns.name: layoutTreeNodes
returns.description: The nodes in the layout tree.

returns.name: computedStyles
returns.description: Whitelisted ComputedStyle properties for each node in the layout tree.

types.description: advance: If the scheduler runs out of immediate work, the virtual time base may fast forward to allow the next delayed task (if any) to run; pause: The virtual time base may not advance; pauseIfNetworkFetchesPending: The virtual time base may not advance if there are any pending resource fetches.

domains.description: This domain provides experimental commands only supported in headless mode.

commands.name: beginFrame
commands.description: Sends a BeginFrame to the target and returns when the frame was completed. Optionally captures a screenshot from the resulting frame. Requires that the target was created with enabled BeginFrameControl. Designed for use with --run-all-compositor-stages-before-draw, see also https://goo.gl/3zHXhB for more background.

parameters.name: frameTimeTicks
parameters.description: Timestamp of this BeginFrame in Renderer TimeTicks (milliseconds of uptime). If not set, the current time will be used.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval between BeginFrames that is reported to the compositor, in milliseconds. Defaults to a 60 frames/second interval, i.e. about 16.666 milliseconds.

parameters.name: noDisplayUpdates
parameters.description: Whether updates should not be committed and drawn onto the display. False by default. If true, only side effects of the BeginFrame will be run, such as layout and animations, but any visual updates may not be visible on the display or in screenshots.

parameters.name: screenshot
parameters.description: If set, a screenshot of the frame will be captured and returned in the response. Otherwise, no screenshot will be captured. Note that capturing a screenshot can fail, for example, during renderer initialization. In such a case, no screenshot data will be returned.

returns.name: hasDamage
returns.description: Whether the BeginFrame resulted in damage and, thus, a new frame was committed to the display. Reported for diagnostic uses, may be removed in the future.

returns.name: screenshotData
returns.description: Base64-encoded image data of the screenshot, if one was requested and successfully taken.

parameters.name: needsBeginFrames
parameters.description: True if BeginFrames are needed, false otherwise.

If a network fetch occurs as a result which encounters a redirect an additional Network.requestIntercepted event will be sent with the same InterceptionId.

parameters.description: If set the requests completes using with the provided base64 encoded raw response, including HTTP status line and headers etc... Must not be set in response to an authChallenge.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: If set the request url will be modified in a way that's not observable by page. Must not be set in response to an authChallenge.

parameters.description: If set this allows the request method to be overridden. Must not be set in response to an authChallenge.

parameters.name: postData
parameters.description: If set this allows postData to be set. Must not be set in response to an authChallenge.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: If set this allows the request headers to be changed. Must not be set in response to an authChallenge.

parameters.name: authChallengeResponse

parameters.description: Paper orientation. Defaults to false.

parameters.description: Display header and footer. Defaults to false.

parameters.description: Print background graphics. Defaults to false.

parameters.description: Scale of the webpage rendering. Defaults to 1.

parameters.description: Paper width in inches. Defaults to 8.5 inches.

parameters.description: Paper height in inches. Defaults to 11 inches.

parameters.name: marginTop
parameters.description: Top margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.name: marginBottom
parameters.description: Bottom margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.name: marginLeft
parameters.description: Left margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.name: marginRight
parameters.description: Right margin in inches. Defaults to 1cm (~0.4 inches).

parameters.description: Paper ranges to print, e.g., '1-5, 8, 11-13'. Defaults to the empty string, which means print all pages.

parameters.name: ignoreInvalidPageRanges
parameters.description: Whether to silently ignore invalid but successfully parsed page ranges, such as '3-2'. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: headerTemplate
parameters.description: HTML template for the print header. Should be valid HTML markup with following classes used to inject printing values into them: - `date`: formatted print date - `title`: document title - `url`: document location - `pageNumber`: current page number - `totalPages`: total pages in the document For example, `` would generate span containing the title.

parameters.name: footerTemplate
parameters.description: HTML template for the print footer. Should use the same format as the `headerTemplate`.

parameters.name: preferCSSPageSize
parameters.description: Whether or not to prefer page size as defined by css. Defaults to false, in which case the content will be scaled to fit the paper size.

domains.description: Debugger domain exposes JavaScript debugging capabilities. It allows setting and removing breakpoints, stepping through execution, exploring stack traces, etc.

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script identifier as reported in the `Debugger.scriptParsed`.

types.description: JavaScript call frame. Array of call frames form the call stack.

properties.name: callFrameId
properties.description: Call frame identifier. This identifier is only valid while the virtual machine is paused.

properties.name: functionName
properties.description: Name of the JavaScript function called on this call frame.

properties.name: scopeChain
properties.description: Scope chain for this call frame.

properties.name: returnValue
properties.description: The value being returned, if the function is at return point.

properties.name: object
properties.description: Object representing the scope. For `global` and `with` scopes it represents the actual object; for the rest of the scopes, it is artificial transient object enumerating scope variables as its properties.

properties.name: startLocation
properties.description: Location in the source code where scope starts

properties.name: endLocation
properties.description: Location in the source code where scope ends

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script identifier as reported in the `Debugger.scriptParsed`.

commands.name: continueToLocation
commands.description: Continues execution until specific location is reached.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to continue to.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables debugger for given page.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables debugger for the given page. Clients should not assume that the debugging has been enabled until the result for this command is received.

commands.name: evaluateOnCallFrame
commands.description: Evaluates expression on a given call frame.

parameters.name: callFrameId
parameters.description: Call frame identifier to evaluate on.

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: Expression to evaluate.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: String object group name to put result into (allows rapid releasing resulting object handles using `releaseObjectGroup`).

parameters.name: includeCommandLineAPI
parameters.description: Specifies whether command line API should be available to the evaluated expression, defaults to false.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: In silent mode exceptions thrown during evaluation are not reported and do not pause execution. Overrides `setPauseOnException` state.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: throwOnSideEffect
parameters.description: Whether to throw an exception if side effect cannot be ruled out during evaluation.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Terminate execution after timing out (number of milliseconds).

returns.name: result
returns.description: Object wrapper for the evaluation result.

parameters.description: Start of range to search possible breakpoint locations in.

parameters.description: End of range to search possible breakpoint locations in (excluding). When not specified, end of scripts is used as end of range.

parameters.name: restrictToFunction
parameters.description: Only consider locations which are in the same (non-nested) function as start.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: List of the possible breakpoint locations.

parameters.description: Debugger will pause when async call with given stack trace is started.

commands.description: Removes JavaScript breakpoint.

commands.description: Restarts particular call frame from the beginning.

parameters.name: callFrameId
parameters.description: Call frame identifier to evaluate on.

commands.description: Resumes JavaScript execution.

commands.description: This method is deprecated - use Debugger.stepInto with breakOnAsyncCall and Debugger.pauseOnAsyncTask instead. Steps into next scheduled async task if any is scheduled before next pause. Returns success when async task is actually scheduled, returns error if no task were scheduled or another scheduleStepIntoAsync was called.

parameters.description: Id of the script to search in.

parameters.description: String to search for.

parameters.description: If true, search is case sensitive.

parameters.description: If true, treats string parameter as regex.

parameters.description: Maximum depth of async call stacks. Setting to `0` will effectively disable collecting async call stacks (default).

commands.name: setBlackboxPatterns
commands.description: Replace previous blackbox patterns with passed ones. Forces backend to skip stepping/pausing in scripts with url matching one of the patterns. VM will try to leave blackboxed script by performing 'step in' several times, finally resorting to 'step out' if unsuccessful.

parameters.name: patterns
parameters.description: Array of regexps that will be used to check script url for blackbox state.

commands.name: setBlackboxedRanges
commands.description: Makes backend skip steps in the script in blackboxed ranges. VM will try leave blacklisted scripts by performing 'step in' several times, finally resorting to 'step out' if unsuccessful. Positions array contains positions where blackbox state is changed. First interval isn't blackboxed. Array should be sorted.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Id of the script.

commands.name: setBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at a given location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to set breakpoint in.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

commands.name: setBreakpointByUrl
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint at given location specified either by URL or URL regex. Once this command is issued, all existing parsed scripts will have breakpoints resolved and returned in `locations` property. Further matching script parsing will result in subsequent `breakpointResolved` events issued. This logical breakpoint will survive page reloads.

parameters.name: lineNumber
parameters.description: Line number to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resources to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: urlRegex
parameters.description: Regex pattern for the URLs of the resources to set breakpoints on. Either `url` or `urlRegex` must be specified.

parameters.name: scriptHash
parameters.description: Script hash of the resources to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: columnNumber
parameters.description: Offset in the line to set breakpoint at.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will only stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: List of the locations this breakpoint resolved into upon addition.

commands.name: setBreakpointOnFunctionCall
commands.description: Sets JavaScript breakpoint before each call to the given function. If another function was created from the same source as a given one, calling it will also trigger the breakpoint.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Function object id.

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Expression to use as a breakpoint condition. When specified, debugger will stop on the breakpoint if this expression evaluates to true.

returns.name: breakpointId
returns.description: Id of the created breakpoint for further reference.

parameters.description: New value for breakpoints active state.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Pause on exceptions mode.

parameters.description: New content of the script.

parameters.description: Id of callframe that holds variable.

types.description: Sampling Heap Profile node. Holds callsite information, allocation statistics and child nodes.

properties.name: selfSize
properties.description: Allocations size in bytes for the node excluding children.

commands.name: addInspectedHeapObject
commands.description: Enables console to refer to the node with given id via $x (see Command Line API for more details $x functions).

parameters.name: heapObjectId
parameters.description: Heap snapshot object id to be accessible by means of $x command line API.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to get heap object id for.

returns.name: heapSnapshotObjectId
returns.description: Id of the heap snapshot object corresponding to the passed remote object id.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects.

returns.name: profile
returns.description: Return the sampling profile being collected.

parameters.name: samplingInterval
parameters.description: Average sample interval in bytes. Poisson distribution is used for the intervals. The default value is 32768 bytes.

parameters.name: reportProgress
parameters.description: If true 'reportHeapSnapshotProgress' events will be generated while snapshot is being taken when the tracking is stopped.

parameters.name: reportProgress
parameters.description: If true 'reportHeapSnapshotProgress' events will be generated while snapshot is being taken.

events.name: heapStatsUpdate
events.description: If heap objects tracking has been started then backend may send update for one or more fragments

parameters.name: statsUpdate
parameters.description: An array of triplets. Each triplet describes a fragment. The first integer is the fragment index, the second integer is a total count of objects for the fragment, the third integer is a total size of the objects for the fragment.

events.name: lastSeenObjectId
events.description: If heap objects tracking has been started then backend regularly sends a current value for last seen object id and corresponding timestamp. If the were changes in the heap since last event then one or more heapStatsUpdate events will be sent before a new lastSeenObjectId event.

types.description: Profile node. Holds callsite information, execution statistics and child nodes.

properties.name: hitCount
properties.description: Number of samples where this node was on top of the call stack.

properties.name: deoptReason
properties.description: The reason of being not optimized. The function may be deoptimized or marked as don't optimize.

properties.name: positionTicks
properties.description: An array of source position ticks.

properties.name: nodes
properties.description: The list of profile nodes. First item is the root node.

properties.name: timeDeltas
properties.description: Time intervals between adjacent samples in microseconds. The first delta is relative to the profile startTime.

types.description: Specifies a number of samples attributed to a certain source position.

properties.name: ticks
properties.description: Number of samples attributed to the source line.

types.description: Coverage data for a source range.

properties.name: startOffset
properties.description: JavaScript script source offset for the range start.

properties.name: endOffset
properties.description: JavaScript script source offset for the range end.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Collected execution count of the source range.

types.description: Coverage data for a JavaScript function.

properties.name: ranges
properties.description: Source ranges inside the function with coverage data.

properties.name: isBlockCoverage
properties.description: Whether coverage data for this function has block granularity.

types.description: Coverage data for a JavaScript script.

properties.name: functions
properties.description: Functions contained in the script that has coverage data.

types.description: Describes a type collected during runtime.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of a type collected with type profiling.

types.description: Source offset and types for a parameter or return value.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Source offset of the parameter or end of function for return values.

properties.name: types
properties.description: The types for this parameter or return value.

types.description: Type profile data collected during runtime for a JavaScript script.

properties.name: entries
properties.description: Type profile entries for parameters and return values of the functions in the script.

commands.name: getBestEffortCoverage
commands.description: Collect coverage data for the current isolate. The coverage data may be incomplete due to garbage collection.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Coverage data for the current isolate.

commands.name: setSamplingInterval
commands.description: Changes CPU profiler sampling interval. Must be called before CPU profiles recording started.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: New sampling interval in microseconds.

commands.name: startPreciseCoverage
commands.description: Enable precise code coverage. Coverage data for JavaScript executed before enabling precise code coverage may be incomplete. Enabling prevents running optimized code and resets execution counters.

parameters.name: callCount
parameters.description: Collect accurate call counts beyond simple 'covered' or 'not covered'.

parameters.name: detailed
parameters.description: Collect block-based coverage.

commands.name: startTypeProfile
commands.description: Enable type profile.

commands.name: stopPreciseCoverage
commands.description: Disable precise code coverage. Disabling releases unnecessary execution count records and allows executing optimized code.

commands.name: stopTypeProfile
commands.description: Disable type profile. Disabling releases type profile data collected so far.

commands.name: takePreciseCoverage
commands.description: Collect coverage data for the current isolate, and resets execution counters. Precise code coverage needs to have started.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Coverage data for the current isolate.

commands.name: takeTypeProfile
commands.description: Collect type profile.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Type profile for all scripts since startTypeProfile() was turned on.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location of console.profileEnd().

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Profile title passed as an argument to console.profile().

events.name: consoleProfileStarted
events.description: Sent when new profile recording is started using console.profile() call.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location of console.profile().

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Profile title passed as an argument to console.profile().

domains.description: Runtime domain exposes JavaScript runtime by means of remote evaluation and mirror objects. Evaluation results are returned as mirror object that expose object type, string representation and unique identifier that can be used for further object reference. Original objects are maintained in memory unless they are either explicitly released or are released along with the other objects in their object group.

types.description: Primitive value which cannot be JSON-stringified. Includes values `-0`, `NaN`, `Infinity`, `-Infinity`, and bigint literals.
Mirror object referencing original JavaScript object.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for `object` type values only.

properties.name: className
properties.description: Object class (constructor) name. Specified for `object` type values only.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Remote object value in case of primitive values or JSON values (if it was requested).

properties.name: unserializableValue
properties.description: Primitive value which can not be JSON-stringified does not have `value`, but gets this property.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: Preview containing abbreviated property values. Specified for `object` type values only.

types.description: Object containing abbreviated remote object value.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for `object` type values only.

properties.name: overflow
properties.description: True iff some of the properties or entries of the original object did not fit.

properties.name: entries
properties.description: List of the entries. Specified for `map` and `set` subtype values only.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Object type. Accessor means that the property itself is an accessor property.

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: Object subtype hint. Specified for `object` type values only.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Preview of the key. Specified for map-like collection entries.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

properties.name: writable
properties.description: True if the value associated with the property may be changed (data descriptors only).

properties.name: get
properties.description: A function which serves as a getter for the property, or `undefined` if there is no getter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: set
properties.description: A function which serves as a setter for the property, or `undefined` if there is no setter (accessor descriptors only).

properties.name: configurable
properties.description: True if the type of this property descriptor may be changed and if the property may be deleted from the corresponding object.

properties.name: enumerable
properties.description: True if this property shows up during enumeration of the properties on the corresponding object.

properties.name: wasThrown
properties.description: True if the result was thrown during the evaluation.

properties.name: isOwn
properties.description: True if the property is owned for the object.

properties.name: symbol
properties.description: Property symbol object, if the property is of the `symbol` type.

types.description: Object internal property descriptor. This property isn't normally visible in JavaScript code.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the property.

types.description: Represents function call argument. Either remote object id `objectId`, primitive `value`, unserializable primitive value or neither of (for undefined) them should be specified.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Primitive value or serializable javascript object.

properties.name: unserializableValue
properties.description: Primitive value which can not be JSON-stringified.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique id of the execution context. It can be used to specify in which execution context script evaluation should be performed.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Human readable name describing given context.

types.description: Detailed information about exception (or error) that was thrown during script compilation or execution.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Exception text, which should be used together with exception object when available.

properties.name: lineNumber
properties.description: Line number of the exception location (0-based).

properties.name: columnNumber
properties.description: Column number of the exception location (0-based).

properties.name: scriptId
properties.description: Script ID of the exception location.

properties.name: url
properties.description: URL of the exception location, to be used when the script was not reported.

properties.name: executionContextId
properties.description: Identifier of the context where exception happened.

types.description: Stack entry for runtime errors and assertions.
Call frames for assertions or error messages.

properties.name: description
properties.description: String label of this stack trace. For async traces this may be a name of the function that initiated the async call.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: Asynchronous JavaScript stack trace that preceded this stack, if available.

properties.name: parentId
properties.description: Asynchronous JavaScript stack trace that preceded this stack, if available.

types.description: If `debuggerId` is set stack trace comes from another debugger and can be resolved there. This allows to track cross-debugger calls. See `Runtime.StackTrace` and `Debugger.paused` for usages.

commands.name: awaitPromise
commands.description: Add handler to promise with given promise object id.

parameters.name: promiseObjectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the promise.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object that should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

returns.name: result
returns.description: Promise result. Will contain rejected value if promise was rejected.

returns.name: exceptionDetails
returns.description: Exception details if stack strace is available.

commands.name: callFunctionOn
commands.description: Calls function with given declaration on the given object. Object group of the result is inherited from the target object.

parameters.name: functionDeclaration
parameters.description: Declaration of the function to call.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: Identifier of the object to call function on. Either objectId or executionContextId should be specified.

parameters.name: arguments
parameters.description: Call arguments. All call arguments must belong to the same JavaScript world as the target object.

parameters.name: silent
parameters.description: In silent mode exceptions thrown during evaluation are not reported and do not pause execution. Overrides `setPauseOnException` state.

parameters.name: returnByValue
parameters.description: Whether the result is expected to be a JSON object which should be sent by value.

parameters.name: generatePreview
parameters.description: Whether preview should be generated for the result.

parameters.name: userGesture
parameters.description: Whether execution should be treated as initiated by user in the UI.

parameters.name: awaitPromise
parameters.description: Whether execution should `await` for resulting value and return once awaited promise is resolved.

parameters.name: executionContextId
parameters.description: Specifies execution context which global object will be used to call function on. Either executionContextId or objectId should be specified.

parameters.name: objectGroup
parameters.description: Symbolic group name that can be used to release multiple objects. If objectGroup is not specified and objectId is, objectGroup will be inherited from object.

commands.name: discardConsoleEntries
commands.description: Discards collected exceptions and console API calls.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables reporting of execution contexts creation by means of `executionContextCreated` event. When the reporting gets enabled the event will be sent immediately for each existing execution context.

parameters.description: In silent mode exceptions thrown during evaluation are not reported and do not pause execution. Overrides `setPauseOnException` state.

commands.name: getIsolateId

commands.name: getHeapUsage

commands.name: getProperties

returns.name: internalProperties
